DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine safety efficacy Tumor Associated Peptide Antigen ( TAPA ) pulse dendritic cell ( DC ) vaccine treatment hematologic malignancy .
DOC.brief_title: Consolidation Therapy Patients With Hematologic Malignancies
DOC.detailed_description: Patients diagnose hematologic malignancy ( define ) respond conventional therapy , without potentially curative therapeutic intervention , candidate Phase I/II study . Following confirmation disease response conventional antineoplastic therapy , eligible patient agree participate sign consent form tumor cell and/or blood analyzed expression specific panel Tumor Associated Peptide Antigens ( TAPAs ) , include SP17 , Ropporin , AKAP4 , PTTG1 Span-xb . Patients whose tumor express one ( 1 ) TAPAs receive three ( 3 ) day subcutaneous Granulocyte Macrophage Colony Stimulating Factor ( GM-CSF ) increase bone marrow production monocyte dendritic cell ( DC ) precursor , peripheral blood mononuclear cell obtain phlebotomy and/or leukapheresis generation autologous DCs . Patient 's DCs generate Kiromic 's Cell Processing Good Manufacturing Process ( GMP ) facility , accord establish Standard Operating Procedures , activate pulsing/loading TAPA ( ) relevant particular patient . Patients receive five ( 5 ) day low-dose cyclophosphamide prior vaccination TAPA-pulsed DCs decrease Treg activity . TAPA-pulsed DCs administer fix dose 1 x 107 DCs least two ( 2 ) day follow cyclophosphamide administration . DC vaccination schedule every fourteen ( 14 ) day via subcutaneous ( SC ) intradermal ( ID ) injection total 6 vaccination . Low dose GM-CSF also administer SC five ( 5 ) consecutive day , start three ( 3 ) six ( 6 ) hour TAPA-pulsed DC treatment , optimize immune response DC viability vivo . Patients follow weekly basis ( frequently require ) evaluate treatment-related toxicity . Immune response anti-tumor response evaluate per protocol specification . Continuation stop rule study define base toxicity/tolerability ( Phase I ) and/or immune response ( Phase II ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Ability provide inform consent . 2 . Patients least eighteen ( 18 ) year age histologically cytologically proven Multiple Myeloma ( MM ) , Hodgkins Disease ( HD ) , NonHodgkins Lymphoma ( NHL ) , Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia ( CML ) , Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia ( ALL ) , Acute Myelogenous Leukemia ( AML ) Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia ( CLL ) , respond standard , firstline antineoplastic therapy , define use standard response criterion specific hematologic malignancy ( HM ) , additional potentially curative therapeutic intervention available , eligible participate study . 3 . Expression one ( 1 ) follow TAPAs : SP17 , AKAP4 , Ropporin , PTTG1 Spanxb , either reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction ( RTPCR ) and/or immunocytochemistry , Western blot ELISA , neoplastic cell and/or blood . 4 . Presence measurable evaluable disease ( unless patient achieve complete response ( CR ) follow firstline antineoplastic therapy ) . 5 . Patients must active infectious process . 6 . Patients must negative test HIV , Hepatitis A , B , C. 7 . Patients must receive active immunosuppressive therapy . 8 . Patients must discontinue systemic antineoplastic therapy ( include systemic corticosteroid exclude tyrosine kinase inhibitor CML ) least four ( 4 ) week prior enrollment . 9 . Patients may know allergy CYP and/or GMCSF . 10 . Patients must willing provide least 250 mL , 500 mL , whole blood obtain phlebotomy and/or consent leukapheresis DC generation . 11 . Adequate renal hepatic function ( creatinine ≤ 2.0 mg/dl , bilirubin ≤ 2.0 mg/dl , aspartate transaminase ( AST ) alanine transaminase ( ALT ) ≤ 4X upper limit normal range ) . 12 . Adequate hematologic function ( Platelets ≥ 60,000/mm3 , lymphocytes ≥ 1,000/mm3 , neutrophil ≥ 750/mm3 , hemoglobin ≥ 10 g/dl ) . 13 . Karnofsky performance status ≥ 70 % . 14 . Expected survival ≥ 6 month . 15 . Patient Human Leukocyte Antigen ( HLA ) type demonstrate HLAA1 restriction . 16 . Either female male reproductive capacity wish participate study must use , agree use , one type birth control entire study 3 month complete study . Birth control method may include condom , diaphragm , birth control pill , spermicidal gel foam , antigonadotropin injection , intrauterine device ( IUD ) , surgical sterilization , subcutaneous implant . Another choice subject 's sexual partner use one birth control method . Women reproductive capacity require undergo urine pregnancy test completion postscreening informed consent process . 1 . Patients HM , previously define , without confirm response standard , firstline antineoplastic therapy , and/or fulfill Inclusion Criteria state , ineligible participate study . 2 . Patients HM undergone myeloablative systemic therapy ineligible participate study . 3 . Patients without measurable evaluable disease ( unless patient achieve complete response ( CR ) follow 1stline antineoplastic therapy ) . 4 . Patients receive cytotoxic therapy , radiation therapy , immunotherapy nontopical steroid HM within four ( 4 ) week enrollment , exclude tyrosine kinase inhibitor patient CML . 5 . Active immunosuppressive cytotoxic therapy ( exclude topical steroid ) condition . 6 . Persistent fever ( > 24 hour ) document repeated measurement active , uncontrolled infection within 4 week enrollment . 7 . Active ischemic heart disease history myocardial infarction within six month . 8 . Active autoimmune disease , include , limited , Systemic Lupus Erythematosus ( SLE ) , Multiple Sclerosis ( MS ) , Ankylosing Spondylitis ( AS ) , Rheumatoid Arthritis ( RA ) . 9 . Pregnancy breast feed . 10 . Patients active second invasive malignancy , basal cell carcinoma skin . 11 . Life expectancy le 6 month . 12 . Patients contraindication CYP and/or GMCSF . 13 . Patients receive organ transplantation . 14 . Patients psychological geographic condition prevent adequate followup compliance study protocol . 15 . Patients diagnose primary central nervous system ( CNS ) CNS metastases/involvement , time disease course , exclude study . 16 . Patients without HLAA1 restriction .
